Title: TCPTrack: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A heap-based buffer overflow in TCPTrack might allow a remote
    attacker to execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: TCPTrack is a simple libpcap based program for live TCP connection monitoring.

Description.Text: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in TCPTrack’s parsing of command line arguments. This is only a vulnerability in limited scenarios in which TCPTrack is “configured as a handler for other applications.”

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition with a specially crafted command-line argument.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All TCPTrack users should upgrade to the latest version:

NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are
      available since August 06, 2011. It is likely that your system is already
      no longer affected by this issue.
